author: Erik Wasson
description: An increasingly rancorous standoff over funding the US government intensified Wednesday as congressional Democrats swung big on a counteroffer, ratcheting up the risk of an Oct. 1 shutdown.
title: Democrats Make Counteroffer in US Government Shutdown Standoff

author: Lucas Shaw
description: Walt Disney Co.’s ABC network is taking Jimmy Kimmel Live off the air indefinitely amid a backlash to remarks the late-night host made about the killing of Republican activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Disney Pulls ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live’ Over Host’s Charlie Kirk Remark

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission approved three exchanges’ request to speed up how quickly they can list exchange-traded products that hold spot commodities like gold or Bitcoin.
title: SEC Approves Faster Way for Exchanges to List Bitcoin, Gold ETPs

author: Ruth Liao, Joe Deaux
description: The Trump administration is close to relaxing certain restrictions for liquefied natural gas companies that are part of a sweeping policy aimed at curbing China’s maritime dominance, according to three people familiar with the plans.
title: USTR Poised to Tweak LNG Penalty Before China-Ship Rule Deadline

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Japan would be a “capable participant” in the evolving US-UK-Australia defense partnership because of its investments in advanced defense systems, industrial-base improvements and cybersecurity protocols, according to an unreleased State Department assessment to Congress.
title: State Department Sees Japanese Role in US-Australia Defense Pact

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Lawmakers who pressed for the ban on the social media app TikTok expressed doubts about a deal the Trump administration is preparing for outside investors to acquire a half-interest in the Chinese company’s US operations.
title: Key Lawmakers Wary of TikTok Deal Trump Administration Preparing

author: Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump’s decision to label alleged drug-runners in the Caribbean as “narco-terrorists” has spurred fresh debate over the legality of his strategy — and prompted speculation he could step up other controversial efforts to pursue enemies at home.
title: Trump’s Latest Boat Strikes Spark Fresh Debate Over Legality

author: Fadwa Hodali, Krishna Karra, Raeedah Wahid, Samy Adghirni
description: As diplomatic calls grow for an independent Palestine to be more widely recognized at the United Nations General Assembly, increased Israeli activity is undermining the viability of such a nation.
title: Recognition of a Palestinian State Rings Hollow in the West Bank

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Former National Security Adviser Mike Waltz cleared a key Senate hurdle on his path to become the next US ambassador to the United Nations but faces slim prospects of winning confirmation ahead of the world body’s annual high-level gathering.
title: Waltz Clears Another Hurdle in Path Toward UN Ambassador Job

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the Federal Reserve’s interest rate decision and what it says about the central bank’s independence. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Fed’s Rate Decision Affirms Its Independence From Political Influence

author: Matthew Boesler
description: Arguably the biggest surprise from the Federal Reserve’s decision Wednesday: Only a single dissenting vote.
title: Lone Dissent Shows Powell Kept Fed United Amid Trump Pressure

author: Catherine Lucey, Kate Sullivan, Maddie Parker
description: President Donald Trump and King Charles III capped a day of pomp and pageantry at Windsor Castle dining on quail egg salad at an elaborate state dinner with tech and finance executives Wednesday.
title: Apple and Citi CEOs Join Trump and King Charles at State Dinner

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was diagnosed with skin cancer, his doctor said on Wednesday, adding to the right-wing leader’s health and legal woes just days after he was convicted of plotting a coup.
title: Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro Is Diagnosed With Skin Cancer Days After Coup Conviction

author: Erik Wasson
description: Jamie Dimon made a surprise visit to the US Capitol on Wednesday, where he discussed economic growth and the Federal Reserve with Senate Republicans just as the central bank was preparing to release its latest rate decision.
title: Dimon Talks Economy and Federal Reserve With Senate Republicans

author: Faith DiBiagio, Randall Williams
description: Connecticut is considering offering up public pension funds to keep the WNBA’s Sun team in the state.
title: Connecticut Weighs Rare Move to Keep Its WNBA Team in the State

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government has decided to appeal a court decision to block the deportation of a migrant who was set to leave the country under a new “one in, one out” deal with France.
title: UK Appeals Effort to Stop Deportation Under French Migrants Deal

author: Maxwell Adler
description: The White House’s push to impose financial penalties on the University of California at Los Angeles threatens the broader state, said James Milliken, president of the University of California system.
title: University of California Head Sees ‘Dark Shadow’ From Trump Plan

author: Ellen Milligan, Kate Sullivan, Catherine Lucey
description: King Charles III’s state banquet hosting US President Donald Trump on Wednesday will have one glaring omission: a British ambassador to Washington.
title: Trump Banquet Highlights Big Hole in Starmer’s Diplomatic Team

author: Christopher Beam
description: Every big news event is a memecoin now.
title: Crypto Bros Are Trying to Monetize Charlie Kirk’s Death

author: Myles Miller, Chris Strohm
description: FBI Director Kash Patel’s first appearance before the House Judiciary Committee quickly broke down along partisan lines as he defended his actions in the Charlie Kirk murder probe while Democrats accused him of concealing files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
title: FBI’s Kash Patel Defends Charlie Kirk Response as Democrats Press on Epstein

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Anxiety within the Republican ranks over Donald Trump’s trade policies bubbled to the surface on the House floor this week when a small group of lawmakers pushed back on the president’s signature foreign economic policy and sought a bigger say in how tariff levels are set.
title: House GOP Races to Cool Dissent as Trump Tariff Anxiety Surfaces

author: Beatriz Reis
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s approval climbed to the highest level since January 2024, according to a poll published just days after his predecessor and rival was sentenced for plotting a coup.
title: Lula’s Approval Hits 20-Month High Before 2026 Presidential Race

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s disapproval rating rose for a third straight month to a new high in September amid bribery allegations involving his sister, while his party’s lead in October’s crucial midterm race narrowed in a new poll.
title: Milei’s Disapproval Rating Hits New High as Midterm Lead Shrinks

author: Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump’s administration plans to nominate Dan Katz, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s chief of staff, to be the International Monetary Fund’s No. 2 official, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Plans to Nominate Treasury’s Dan Katz as IMF’s No. 2 Official

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: European Union member states approved negotiations with Canada and the UK that would give them access to the bloc’s €150 billion ($178 billion) fund aimed at accelerating investment in the defense industry.
title: EU to Start Talks With UK, Canada on €150 Billion Defense Fund

author: Myles Miller
description: Federal and local authorities are searching for a man who rammed his vehicle into the entrance gate of the FBI’s Pittsburgh field office before fleeing on foot, in what officials described as a targeted attack on the bureau.
title: FBI Seeks Suspect After Car Rams Into Pittsburgh Field Office

author: Prejula Prem
description: Weekly oil exports slump, driven by slide in Baltic shipments
title: Russia’s Crude Exports Lose Momentum After Baltic Flows Targeted

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union and Indonesia have concluded trade talks after nearly a decade as part of the bloc’s efforts to diversify its supply chains and open new markets.
title: EU Wraps Up Trade Deal With Indonesia in Push for New Markets

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia’s economy minister signaled that the European Union member state would resist pressure from US President Donald Trump to cut Russian oil and gas imports until the country has sufficient alternative supplies.
title: Slovakia Resists Trump Pressure to Quickly Halt Russian Energy

author: Anthony Cormier, Zachary R Mider
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent once agreed to occupy two different houses as his “principal residence” at the same time, mortgage documents show — the same kind of contradictory pledges that President Donald Trump has been using to try to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook.
title: Bessent, Like Fed Governor, Made Contradictory Mortgage Pledges

author: Kati Pohjanpalo
description: Denmark is adding missiles and drones into its future arsenal as the Nordic nation seeks to boost deterrence against a more aggressive Russia.
title: Denmark Adds Missiles, Drones to Defense Tools on Russian Risk

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Bill Allison
description: Steve Witkoff has yet to divest his crypto assets, including a stake in the Trump family linked-World Liberty Financial, according to the White House, potentially posing a conflict of interest for the president’s special envoy for peace missions.
title: US Special Envoy Is Still Holding Trump-Linked Crypto Assets

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union proposed suspending Israel’s preferential trade benefits as part of a new package of sanctions in response to the deteriorating humanitarian situation in Gaza.
title: EU Proposes Suspending Israel Trade Perks Over Human Rights

author: Dan Williams, Fares Alghoul
description: Israeli tanks and troops on Sept. 16 began thrusting into the heart of Gaza City, the main stronghold of Hamas.
title: Can Israel End Its War With Hamas With a New Push Into Gaza City?

author: Max Ramsay
description: The European Union is embracing closer ties with India, as the bloc aims to diversify its trade ties and expand its global influence.
title: EU Unveils Push for Closer India Defense, Trade Ties

author: Frances Schwartzkopff, Laura Noonan
description: The European Commission is taking steps to ensure that regulations meant to support sustainable investing don’t clash with the bloc’s efforts to pump capital into its defense industry.
title: EU Warns Against ‘Undue’ Bias Toward Defense Sector in ESG Funds

author: Marton Eder
description: Austria is extending a limit on home-rental-fee increases to the free market in its latest measure aimed at improving affordability and tempering price pressures.
title: Austria Extends Home Rent Controls to Private Contracts

author: Dan Williams
description: Should the surviving fighters refuse to give in, the outlook looks bleak for Gaza and the Israeli hostages.
title: Israel’s Gaza City Sweep is Fateful for Hamas

author: Loni Prinsloo, Antony Sguazzin, Alexander Parker
description: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer and South African Trade Minister Parks Tau are expected to meet on Thursday in a bid to resolve an impasse over tariffs, people with knowledge of the matter said.
title: Trump’s Trade Envoy to Meet With South African Minister

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Michael Nienaber
description: Momentum is building in Europe to expand the use of frozen Russian assets to finance Ukraine, following new pressure from US president Donald Trump and a shift in Germany’s stance.
title: Germany Backs Further Use of Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine

author: Catherine Lucey, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump’s state visit to the UK is about to get under way, with the promise of deals and diplomacy jostling with the constant threat of global and domestic tensions intruding on the royal fanfare.
title: Trump’s UK State Visit Promises Deals, Diplomacy — and Protests

author: Michael Nienaber, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz warned that Germany is facing a perilous watershed moment and vowed that his government will make the right choices to protect freedom, economic prosperity and social cohesion.
title: In Heated Debate, Merz Warns German Prosperity Under Threat

author: Swati Pandey
description: Military cooperation between the US and India remains steady, with an annual exercise concluding this weekend underscoring strong bilateral defense ties despite growing political and economic discord, analysts said.
title: US, India Maintain Military Ties Even as Trade Frictions Mount

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia’s strategic outlook is darkening because of intensifying great-power rivalry between the US and China, according to a senior government official.
title: Australian Strategic Outlook Darkening, Government Official Says

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s top trade negotiator continued talks in Washington this week on a $350 billion investment pledge after an unprecedented US immigration raid stoked tensions, fueling debate in Seoul over whether the outlay is worth pursuing.
title: Korea-US Trade Talks Remain in Deadlock After Raid Fuels Tension

author: Misha Savic, Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Andrea Dudik
description: More violence over the summer has betrayed the depth of discontentment in a country that the EU has been trying to keep onside.
title: The Student-Led Protests Against Serbia’s Government That Won’t Stop

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu will meet with Socialist party leaders Wednesday for pivotal budget talks as he seeks support for a treacherous budget process..
title: French Premier to Meet With Socialists, Who May Hold Budget Key

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: A proposal to abolish a century-old property tax in Switzerland is losing support among voters ahead of a ballot in less than two weeks on overhauling housing levies.
title: Swiss Support for Property Tax Abolition Wanes Before Vote

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese must use his upcoming meeting with President Donald Trump to make the case to revive the Quad security group, former US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said.
title: Biden Official Urges Australia to Press Trump to Revive Quad

author: Lucille Liu
description: Europe’s top business lobby in China urged Beijing to address price wars and unsustainable competition as the country readies its next five-year plan — adding to pressure from the US over the matter.
title: Europe’s Top Business Lobby in China Urges an End to Price Wars

author: Neil Jerome Morales, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Congressman Martin Romualdez will step down as speaker of the Philippines’ House of Representatives, one of his deputies said, just over a week after a similar change in leadership at the Senate.
title: Marcos Cousin to Step Down as Philippines’ Congress Speaker

author: Michael Heath
description: Australia and northern neighbor Papua New Guinea have agreed on a new security pact timed to the Pacific nation’s 50th anniversary of independence, strengthening Canberra’s push to curb China’s influence in the region.
title: Australia and PNG Sign Security Communique, Limiting China Gains

author: Dan Strumpf, Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Ruchi Bhatia, Swati Gupta
description: Just over a year ago, as Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi reeled from the worst election setback of his career, speculation mounted that the nation’s most dominant politician in a generation was at risk of losing power.
title: Modi Fends Off Succession Talk in India Despite Many Setbacks
